bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. COLE:H.R. 5862.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to Article I, Section 8 whichallows Congress to regulate trade amongst the Indian Tribes.This bill is enacted pursuant to treaties lawfully enteredinto and ratified pursuant to the power granted to Congressunder Article II, Section 2, Clause 2.This bill is enacted pursuant to Article III Section 2which grants Congress power to regulate jurisdiction incourts inferior to the United States Supreme Court[Page H3266]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee Indian and Alaska Native Affairs.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to pay, out of money not otherwise appropriated, unspecified sums to the Quapaw Tribe of Oklahoma (O-Gah-Pah) and to its tribal members pursuant to a judgment rendered by the U.S. Court of Federal Claims.

bill.title: Relating to members of the Quapaw Tribe of Oklahoma (O-Gah-Pah).

item.title: Relating to members of the Quapaw Tribe of Oklahoma (O-Gah-Pah).
Relating to members of the Quapaw Tribe of Oklahoma (O-Gah-Pah).

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee Indian and Alaska Native Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
